Sentencas: Porous Ni/YSZ cermets (YSZ: yttria stabilized zirconia) have been extensively studied as anodes for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) due to its low cost, high electrical conductivity chemical stability and thermal,, expansion coefficient close to that of YSZ-electrolyte.
Titulo: Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications

Sentencas: The properties of these anodes are highly dependent on the particle size and microstructure of the cermet.
Titulo: Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications

Sentencas: In the present work, Ni/YSZ cermet was prepared with 30 wt% of NiO by two different routes, co-precipitation (CP) and combustion (CB), and calcination at 600, 800 and 1000 degrees C.
Titulo: Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications

Sentencas: The prepared cermets were characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and temperature programmed reduction (TPR).
Titulo: Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications

Sentencas: The mean crystallite size of NiO is smaller for CB samples (20-33 nm), showing a higher Ni dispersion of these systems.
Titulo: Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications

Sentencas: Also, CB samples presented a more homogeneous particle size distribution, mainly at high calcination temperatures.
Titulo: Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications

Sentencas: The cermets also presented good catalytic activity and stability at 900 degrees C in steam reforming of methane, showing high resistance to coke deposition and to sintering of metallic particles.
Titulo: Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications
Investigating the microstructure and catalytic properties of Ni/YSZ cermets as anodes for SOFC applications
